publisher.value: Thieme Compliance GmbH, Am Weichselgarten 30a, 91058 Erlangen

description.value: The patient history form “Basic Patient History for Adults – Questions to Minimise the Operation Risks (SystA)” presents an extensive medical and familial patient history before starting an operation and is intended to help identify any health disorders that the patient may have, to evaluate whether or not undergoing the operation poses a risk to the patient’s health because of his/​her health condition and thus to minimise the risks associated with an operation.

text.value: Please fill in your date of birth.
Please fill in your height (in cm), your weight (in kg) as well as your gender.
Will the procedure be performed on an outpatient or inpatient basis?
Information on your personal circumstances
Do you understand written and spoken German?

valueString.value: The occupation/​profession is important to know if you are working in a dangerous profession or have contact with substances possibly detrimental to your health. The procedure can possibly also impair the performance of your occupation/​profession.

text.value: Occupation/​profession:
Do you live on your own?

valueString.value: Please answer the question truthfully since alcohol can affect the effectiveness of the anaesthetic agents.

valueString.value: If you are a smoker, it can e.g. increase the risk of impaired wound healing or formation of thromboses.

valueString.value: Metamizole: e.g. Novalgin®; antibiotics: e.g. Penicillin
Most surgical gloves are still made from latex.

text.value: Do you have an allergy/​hypersensitivity to metals?

valueString.value: Among others, this is understood to refer to the development of abscesses (accumulations of pus) and/​or fistulas (unnatural communication tracts between hollow organs or hollow organs and the body’s surface).

valueString.value: Disease/​weakness of the immune system, triggered by a virus
Inflammation of the central nervous system, caused by bacteria or viruses in particular
Bacterial infectious disease affecting the lungs in most cases

Questions on the blood and immune system

valueString.value: This information is very important, especially with regard to surgical procedures!

text.value: Do you have an increased tendency to bleed, e.g. frequent nosebleeds/​bleeding gums, bruises, longer bleeding after injury?

valueString.value: A pathological tendency to bleed can be congenital.

text.value: Do you have any blood relatives who have an increased tendency to bleed?

valueString.value: This type of disorder can cause increased bleeding and therefore cause severe complications.

text.value: Do you have a coagulation disorder?
Do you have or have you ever had any diseases of the blood?

valueString.value: Red blood cells or haemoglobin deficiency
A specific type of bone marrow cancer, also called plasmacytoma.

text.value: Do you have any disorders of the immune system?
Do you have or have you ever had cancer?
Questions on the central nervous system
Do you have or have you ever had any diseases of the nervous system?

valueString.value: Slowly progressing disease of the brain
Sensory disorders (tingling and sensation of cold) or paralysis in the legs, feet, more rarely in the arms

text.value: Have you ever had a stroke?
If yes, are there any residual impairments?
Questions on mental health

valueString.value: Please answer this question truthfully since this can be relevant for your own safety under certain circumstances.

text.value: Do you have any psychiatric disorders?

valueString.value: Deep emotional, mental and physical exhaustion
Psychiatric disorder which causes the affected person to perceive or process reality differently.
Psychiatric disorder with disordered perception of the self

text.value: Questions on vascular diseases
Have you ever had a vascular obstruction due to a blood clot (thrombosis/​embolism)?
Do you have or have you ever had (another) vascular disease?

valueString.value: The arteries are narrowed due to pathological changes (in particular plaque deposits).
The coronary arteries supply the heart muscle with blood; a constriction causes coronary heart disease.
Pathological dilatation/​outpouching of an artery (frequently in the abdominal aorta, in the brain)

text.value: Questions on cardiovascular health
Do you have or have you ever had (another) cardiovascular disease?

valueString.value: Arteriosclerosis causes constriction of the coronary arteries. This may lead to a heart attack.
Tight feeling in the chest with sudden-onset pain behind the sternum
Myocarditis, an inflammatory process in the cardiac muscle

text.value: Do you get out of breath when climbing the stairs?
If yes, how many stairs can you climb before needing to stop?
Questions on the lungs and airways
Do you have or have you ever had any diseases of the airways/​lungs?

valueString.value: Inflammation of the lungs caused by bacteria, viruses or fungi.
Chronic disease causing temporary or permanent constriction of the airways.
Enlargement (hyperinflation) of the lungs associated with breathing difficulties and a dry cough; pulmonary emphysema.

text.value: Do you experience respiratory distress (breathing difficulties) during the night?

valueString.value: Recurring pauses in breathing during sleep

text.value: Questions on the skin
Do you have any skin diseases?
Have you ever developed excessive scar tissue, e.g. keloids, with previous wounds?
Questions on the muscles and the skeletal system
Do you have or have you ever had any muscle or skeletal diseases?

valueString.value: Deterioration of muscle mass with resulting lack of development of strength of the muscle
Loss of bone density; the bones lose their stability and break more easily (bone atrophy)

text.value: Do you have a damaged spinal column?

valueString.value: narrowing of the spinal canal (spinal canal stenosis)

text.value: Do you have joint problems?
Do you have a weakness of the abdominal wall?
Questions on the teeth/​dental health
Are there any unusual disorders/​features with respect to the condition of your teeth?
Questions on digestion
Do you have or have you ever had any disorders of the digestive system?
Do you currently have difficulties eating?
Do you currently have issues with digestion?
Do you frequently suffer from heartburn?
Do you suffer from a reflux disorder?
Do you have a diaphragmatic hernia?
Questions on the upper abdominal organs
Have you had any diseases of the upper abdominal organs?

valueString.value: Pathologically increased fat content of liver tissue (fatty liver disease)
Liver cirrhosis due to chronic liver inflammation

text.value: Questions on the kidneys/​efferent urinary organs
Do you have or have you ever had any diseases or malformation of the kidneys/​urinary organs?

valueString.value: The concentration of certain metabolic end products (e.g. creatinine, urea, uric acid) in the blood is increased. This causes underactivity of one or both kidneys (renal insufficiency).
e.g. inflammation of the urinary bladder

text.value: Questions for men
Do you have or have you ever had any diseases of the prostate?
Do you suffer from disorders of sexual function?
Questions on the endocrine system
Do you have or have you ever had any diseases of the thyroid gland?

valueString.value: The thyroid gland is producing too many hormones. Possible symptoms are restlessness, shivering, racing heartbeat, weight loss, excessive sweating.
The thyroid gland is producing too few hormones. Possible symptoms are fatigue, weight gain, memory problems, dry skin, goitre. Frequently, the thyroid gland is enlarged due to an iodine deficiency.
Visible enlargement of the thyroid gland
Autoimmune disorder causing chronic inflammation of the thyroid gland.

text.value: Do you have any metabolic diseases?

valueString.value: Metabolic disease primarily causing painful inflammation in the joints. The cause is an excess of uric acid in the blood.

text.value: Do you have any other endocrinologic disease?
Do you have any other diseases?
If yes, please indicate!
Questions on previous treatments/​examinations
Have you received any other medical treatment in the last few weeks?
If yes, please indicate why!

valueString.value: Please tell us all medications (including herbal and over the counter medications, drops, ointments, etc.) which you are taking or applying.

text.value: Are you taking any medications?

valueString.value: They also include e.g. Plavix®, Pradaxa®, Xarelto®, Eliquis®, Lixiana®, heparin.
Medications for treatment of diabetes. Metformin can cause acidosis of the blood. Before measures including application of contrast media can be taken, you must stop Metformin if indicated!
e.g. beta blockers, ACE inhibitors, diuretics
e.g. the oral contraceptives, hormone therapy for patients with prostate cancer or breast cancer

text.value: Are you taking any medications that weaken the immune system and thus the body’s immune defence?
Are you taking herbal medication/​supplements?

valueString.value: Full elimination of pain sensation and consciousness.

Anaesthesia of a small area on the body’s surface
Administration of sedatives to achieve a sleep-like state.

text.value: If yes, did any complications develop?

valueString.value: In this type of examination, the organs are viewed from the inside using a rigid or flexible instrument, e.g. gastroscopy, colonoscopy.

valueString.value: We are asking about this since a certain interval should be between a vaccination and a surgical procedure.

valueString.value: e.g. for breast enlargement or as an artificial vertebrae
